title: Recognizable Realizability
abstract:
We introduce a notion of realizability with ordinal Turing machines based on
recognizability rather than computability, i.e., the ability to uniquely
identify an object. We show that the arising concept of $r$-realizabilty has
the property that all axioms of Kripke-Platek set theory are $r$-realizable and
that the set of $r$-realizable statements is closed under intuitionistic
provability.
